library.name: Accumulators
library.description: Framework for incremental calculation, and collection of statistical accumulators.

library.name: Algorithm
library.description: A collection of useful generic algorithms.

library.name: Min-Max
library.description: Standard library extensions for simultaneous min/max and min/max element computations.

library.name: String Algo
library.description: String algorithms library.

library.name: Any
library.description: Safe, generic container for single values of different value types.

library.name: Array
library.description: STL compliant container wrapper for arrays of constant size.

library.name: Asio
library.description: Portable networking, including sockets, timers, hostname resolution and socket iostreams.

library.name: Assign
library.description: Filling containers with constant or generated data has never been easier.

library.name: Atomic
library.description: C++11-style atomic<>.

library.name: Bimap
library.description: Bidirectional maps library for C++. With Boost.Bimap you can create associative containers in which both types can be used as key.

library.name: Bind
library.description: boost::bind is a generalization of the standard functions std::bind1st and std::bind2nd. It supports arbitrary function objects, functions, function pointers, and member function pointers, and is able to bind any argument to a specific value or route input arguments into arbitrary positions.

library.name: Member Function
library.description: Generalized binders for function/object/pointers and member functions.

library.name: Ref
library.authors: Jaako Järvi, Peter Dimov, Doug Gregor, and Dave Abrahams
library.description: A utility library for passing references to generic functions.

library.name: Chrono
library.description: Useful time utilities.

library.name: Circular Buffer
library.description: A STL compliant container also known as ring or cyclic buffer.

library.name: Compatibility
library.description: Help for non-conforming standard libraries.

library.name: Concept Check
library.description: Tools for generic programming.

library.name: Config
library.description: Helps Boost library developers adapt to compiler idiosyncrasies; not intended for library users.

library.name: Container
library.description: Standard library containers and extensions.

library.name: Context
library.description: Context switching library.

library.name: Conversion
library.description: Polymorphic and lexical casts.

library.name: Coroutine
library.description: Coroutine library.

library.name: CRC
library.description: The Boost CRC Library provides two implementations of CRC (cyclic redundancy code) computation objects and two implementations of CRC computation functions. The implementations are template-based.

library.name: Date Time
library.description: A set of date-time libraries based on generic programming concepts.

library.name: Dynamic Bitset
library.description: The dynamic_bitset class represents a set of bits. It provides accesses to the value of individual bits via an operator[] and provides all of the bitwise operators that one can apply to builtin integers, such as operator& and operator<<. The number of bits in the set is specified at runtime via a parameter to the constructor of the dynamic_bitset.

library.name: Exception
library.description: The Boost Exception library supports transporting of arbitrary data in exception objects, and transporting of exceptions between threads.

library.name: Filesystem
library.description: The Boost Filesystem Library provides portable facilities to query and manipulate paths, files, and directories.

library.name: Flyweight
library.description: Design pattern to manage large quantities of highly redundant objects.

library.name: Foreach
library.description: In C++, writing a loop that iterates over a sequence is tedious. We can either use iterators, which requires a considerable amount of boiler-plate, or we can use the std::for_each() algorithm and move our loop body into a predicate, which requires no less boiler-plate and forces us to move our logic far from where it will be used. In contrast, some other languages, like Perl, provide a dedicated "foreach" construct that automates this process. BOOST_FOREACH is just such a construct for C++. It iterates over sequences for us, freeing us from having to deal directly with iterators or write predicates.

library.name: Format
library.description: The format library provides a class for formatting arguments according to a format-string, as does printf, but with two major differences: format sends the arguments to an internal stream, and so is entirely type-safe and naturally supports all user-defined types; the ellipsis (...) can not be used correctly in the strongly typed context of format, and thus the function call with arbitrary arguments is replaced by successive calls to an argument feeding operator%.

library.name: Function
library.description: Function object wrappers for deferred calls or callbacks.

library.name: Function Types
library.description: Boost.FunctionTypes provides functionality to classify, decompose and synthesize function, function pointer, function reference and pointer to member types.

library.name: Functional
library.description: The Boost.Function library contains a family of class templates that are function object wrappers.

library.name: Functional/Hash
library.description: A TR1 hash function object that can be extended to hash user defined types.

library.name: Functional/Factory
library.description: Function object templates for dynamic and static object creation

library.name: Functional/Forward
library.description: Adapters to allow generic function objects to accept arbitrary arguments

library.name: Functional/Overloaded Function
library.description: Overload different functions into a single function object.

library.name: Fusion
library.authors: Joel de Guzman, Dan Marsden and Tobias Schwinger
library.description: Library for working with tuples, including various containers, algorithms, etc.

library.name: Geometry
library.authors: Barend Gehrels, Bruno Lalande and Mateusz Loskot
library.description: Geometry Library.

library.name: Geometry
library.authors: Barend Gehrels, Bruno Lalande, Mateusz Loskot and Adam Wulkiewicz
library.description: Geometry Library.

library.name: GIL
library.description: Generic Image Library

library.name: Graph
library.authors: Jeremy Siek and a University of Notre Dame team; now maintained by Andrew Sutton and Jeremiah Willcock.
library.description: The BGL graph interface and graph components are generic, in the same sense as the the Standard Template Library (STL).

library.name: Heap
library.description: Priority queue data structures.

library.name: ICL
library.description: Interval Container Library, interval sets and maps and aggregation of associated values

library.name: Integer
library.description: The organization of boost integer headers and classes is designed to take advantage of <stdint.h> types from the 1999 C standard without resorting to undefined behavior in terms of the 1998 C++ standard. The header <boost/cstdint.hpp> makes the standard integer types safely available in namespace boost without placing any names in namespace std.

library.name: Interprocess
library.description: Shared memory, memory mapped files, process-shared mutexes, condition variables, containers and allocators.

library.name: Intrusive
library.description: Intrusive containers and algorithms.

library.name: IO State Savers
library.description: The I/O sub-library of Boost helps segregate the large number of Boost headers. This sub-library should contain various items to use with/for the standard I/O library.

library.name: Iostreams
library.description: Boost.IOStreams provides a framework for defining streams, stream buffers and i/o filters.

library.name: Iterator
library.authors: Dave Abrahams, Jeremy Siek, and Thomas Witt
library.description: The Boost Iterator Library contains two parts. The first is a system of concepts which extend the C++ standard iterator requirements. The second is a framework of components for building iterators based on these extended concepts and includes several useful iterator adaptors.

library.name: Lambda
library.description: Define small unnamed function objects at the actual call site, and more.

library.name: Lexical Cast
library.description: General literal text conversions, such as an int represented a string, or vice-versa, from Kevlin Henney.

library.name: Local Function
library.description: Program functions locally, within other functions, directly within the scope where they are needed.

library.name: Locale
library.description: Provide localization and Unicode handling tools for C++.

library.name: Lockfree
library.description: Lockfree data structures.

library.name: Log
library.description: Logging library.

library.name: Tribool
library.description: 3-state boolean type library.

library.name: Math
library.description: Boost.Math includes several contributions in the domain of mathematics: The Greatest Common Divisor and Least Common Multiple library provides run-time and compile-time evaluation of the greatest common divisor (GCD) or least common multiple (LCM) of two integers. The Special Functions library currently provides eight templated special functions, in namespace boost. The Complex Number Inverse Trigonometric Functions are the inverses of trigonometric functions currently present in the C++ standard. Quaternions are a relative of complex numbers often used to parameterise rotations in three dimentional space. Octonions, like quaternions, are a relative of complex numbers.

library.name: Math Common Factor
library.description: Greatest common divisor and least common multiple.

library.name: Math Common Factor
library.description: Greatest common divisor and least common multiple.

library.name: Math Octonion
library.description: Octonions.

library.name: Math Octonion
library.description: Octonions.

library.name: Math Quaternion
library.description: Quaternions.

library.name: Math Quaternion
library.description: Quaternions.

library.name: Math/Special Functions
library.authors: John Maddock, Paul Bristow, Hubert Holin and Xiaogang Zhang
library.description: A wide selection of mathematical special functions.

library.name: Math/Special Functions
library.authors: John Maddock, Paul Bristow, Hubert Holin and Xiaogang Zhang
library.description: A wide selection of mathematical special functions.

library.name: Math/Statistical Distributions
library.description: A wide selection of univariate statistical distributions and functions that operate on them.

library.name: Math/Statistical Distributions
library.description: A wide selection of univariate statistical distributions and functions that operate on them.

library.name: Move
library.description: Portable move semantics for C++03 and C++11 compilers.

library.name: MPI
library.description: Message Passing Interface library, for use in distributed-memory parallel application programming.

library.name: MPL
library.description: The Boost.MPL library is a general-purpose, high-level C++ template metaprogramming framework of compile-time algorithms, sequences and metafunctions. It provides a conceptual foundation and an extensive set of powerful and coherent tools that make doing explict metaprogramming in C++ as easy and enjoyable as possible within the current language.

library.name: Meta State Machine
library.description: A very high-performance library for expressive UML2 finite state machines.

library.name: Multi-Array
library.description: Boost.MultiArray provides a generic N-dimensional array concept definition and common implementations of that interface.

library.name: Multi-Index
library.description: The Boost Multi-index Containers Library provides a class template named multi_index_container which enables the construction of containers maintaining one or more indices with different sorting and access semantics.

library.name: Multiprecision
library.description: Extended precision arithmetic types for floating point, integer andrational arithmetic.

library.name: Numeric Conversion
library.description: Optimized Policy-based Numeric Conversions.

library.name: Interval
library.authors: Guillaume Melquiond, Hervé Brönnimann and Sylvain Pion
library.description: Extends the usual arithmetic functions to mathematical intervals.

library.name: Odeint
library.description: Solving ordinary differential equations.

library.name: uBLAS
library.description: uBLAS provides matrix and vector classes as well as basic linear algebra routines. Several dense, packed and sparse storage schemes are supported.

library.name: Optional
library.description: Discriminated-union wrapper for optional values.

library.name: Parameter
library.description: Boost.Parameter Library - Write functions that accept arguments by name.

library.name: Phoenix
library.authors: Joel de Guzman, Dan Marsden and Thomas Heller
library.description: Define small unnamed function objects at the actual call site, and more.

library.name: Polygon
library.description: Booleans/clipping, resizing/offsetting and more for planar polygons with integral coordinates.

library.name: Polygon
library.description: Voronoi diagram construction and booleans/clipping, resizing/offsetting and more for planar polygons with integral coordinates.

library.name: Pool
library.description: Memory pool management.

library.name: Preprocessor
library.description: Preprocessor metaprogramming tools including repetition and recursion.

library.name: Program Options
library.description: The program_options library allows program developers to obtain program options, that is (name, value) pairs from the user, via conventional methods such as command line and config file.

library.name: Property Map
library.description: Concepts defining interfaces which map key objects to value objects.

library.name: Property Tree
library.description: A tree data structure especially suited to storing configuration data.

library.name: Proto
library.description: Expression template library and compiler construction toolkit for domain-specific embedded languages.

library.name: Pointer Container
library.description: Containers for storing heap-allocated polymorphic objects to ease OO-programming.

library.name: Python
library.description: The Boost Python Library is a framework for interfacing Python and C++. It allows you to quickly and seamlessly expose C++ classes functions and objects to Python, and vice-versa, using no special tools -- just your C++ compiler.

library.name: Random
library.description: A complete system for random number generation.

library.name: Range
library.description: A new infrastructure for generic algorithms that builds on top of the new iterator concepts.

library.name: Ratio
library.description: Compile time rational arithmetic.

library.name: Rational
library.description: A rational number class.

library.name: Regex
library.description: Regular expression library.

library.name: Scope Exit
library.description: Execute arbitrary code at scope exit.

library.name: Serialization
library.description: Serialization for persistence and marshalling.

library.name: Signals
library.description: Managed signals & slots callback implementation.

library.name: Signals
library.description: Managed signals & slots callback implementation.

library.name: Signals2
library.description: Managed signals & slots callback implementation (thread-safe version 2).

library.name: Smart Ptr
library.authors: Greg Colvin, Beman Dawes, Peter Dimov, Darin Adler and Glen Fernandes
library.description: Smart pointer class templates.

library.name: Static Assert
library.description: Static assertions (compile time assertions).

library.name: Spirit
library.authors: Joel de Guzman, Hartmut Kaiser, and Dan Nuffer
library.description: LL parser framework represents parsers directly as EBNF grammars in inlined C++.

library.name: Statechart
library.description: Boost.Statechart - Arbitrarily complex finite state machines can be implemented in easily readable and maintainable C++ code.

library.name: System
library.description: Operating system support, including the diagnostics support that will be part of the C++0x standard library.

library.name: Test
library.description: Support for simple program testing, full unit testing, and for program execution monitoring.

library.name: Thread
library.description: Portable C++ multi-threading.

library.name: Thread
library.authors: Vicente J. Botet Escribá, Anthony Williams (originally William Kempf)
library.description: Portable C++ multi-threading.

library.name: Timer
library.description: Event timer, progress timer, and progress display classes.

library.name: Tokenizer
library.description: Break of a string or other character sequence into a series of tokens.

library.name: TR1
library.description: The TR1 library provides an implementation of the C++ Technical Report on Standard Library Extensions. This library does not itself implement the TR1 components, rather it's a thin wrapper that will include your standard library's TR1 implementation (if it has one), otherwise it will include the Boost Library equivalents, and import them into namespace std::tr1.

library.name: TTI
library.description: Type Traits Introspection library.

library.name: Tuple
library.description: Ease definition of functions returning multiple values, and more.

library.name: Type Erasure
library.description: Runtime polymorphism based on concepts.

library.name: Type Traits
library.authors: John Maddock, Steve Cleary, et al
library.description: Templates for fundamental properties of types.

library.name: Typeof
library.description: Typeof operator emulation.

library.name: Units
library.description: Zero-overhead dimensional analysis and unit/quantity manipulation and conversion.

library.name: Unordered
library.description: Unordered associative containers.

library.name: Utility
library.description: Class noncopyable plus checked_delete(), checked_array_delete(), next(), prior() function templates, plus base-from-member idiom.

library.name: Call Traits
library.authors: John Maddock, Howard Hinnant, et al
library.description: Defines types for passing parameters.

library.name: Compressed Pair
library.authors: John Maddock, Howard Hinnant, et al
library.description: Empty member optimization.

library.name: Enable If
library.authors: Jaakko Järvi, Jeremiah Willcock, and Andrew Lumsdaine
library.description: Selective inclusion of function template overloads.

library.name: Identity Type
library.description: Wrap types within round parenthesis so they can always be passed as macro parameters.

library.name: In Place Factory, Typed In Place Factory
library.description: Generic in-place construction of contained objects with a variadic argument-list.

library.name: Operators
library.description: Templates ease arithmetic classes and iterators.

library.name: Result Of
library.description: Determines the type of a function call expression.

library.name: Swap
library.description: Enhanced generic swap function.

library.name: Value Initialized
library.description: Wrapper for uniform-syntax value initialization, based on the original idea of David Abrahams.

library.name: Uuid
library.description: A universally unique identifier.

library.name: Variant
library.description: Safe, generic, stack-based discriminated union container.

library.name: Wave
library.description: The Boost.Wave library is a Standards conformant, and highly configurable implementation of the mandated C99/C++ preprocessor functionality packed behind an easy to use iterator interface.

library.name: Xpressive
library.description: Regular expressions that can be written as strings or as expression templates, and which can refer to each other and themselves recursively with the power of context-free grammars.
